title: MASSIVE nutpunch-level nerf/gutting of Thornmail on PBE!!!
body:
{{item:3075}} 

> UNIQUE Passive now reflects 15% of damage + 25% of the user’s bonus Armor, changed from 30% of damage
 

APPARENTLY it isnt enough that ADCs are the ONLY required class, nor that you MUST have a ranged ADC to siege towers or take objectives reliably.

All must bow before the ADC overlords.  NONE may be allowed to survive their damage.  Any teamates exist only to protect and support their ADC masters and bask in their radiance

If you do the math, even with 200 bonus armor this is a WHOPPING 30% nerf vs crits against an AA based ADC like ashe/cait/jinx with 300 AD and IE/PD.  You wont break even until over 400 bonus armor.
**
OH WAIT THATS BEFORE YOU GET ARMOR SHREDDED BY UBIQUITOUS BLACK CLEAVER OR CHAMP ABILITIES.  So in reality you would need 600 bonus armor factoring in a 30% shred  JUST TO BREAK EVEN with current Thornmail**

The only ADC who do significant on-hit damage are vayne and koggy.  This change is at best a wash against them.

**TL;DR:  The one item in the game that had some measurable countering effect on ADC is now nerfed into oblivion.  It provided NO health, NO magic resist, NO offence whatsoever.  It was a sacrifice of an ENTIRE item slot just to marginally challenge ADC using MOUSE2 on you and destroying you even if you were a tank.**

**Welcome to the league of ADCs**


> Bonus math section!

ADC with 300 AD from IE PD BT LW BOOTS GA
300 AD, 55% CRIT (almost exactly 5/9)

TANK with 200 BONUS armor

9 attacks
4 NONCRIT for 300 apiece, 1200 subtotal
5 CRIT for 750 apiece, 3750 subtotal
4950 total raw dmg.


95 returned noncrit with new TM, 380 subtotal
162 returned crit with new TM, 815 subtotal
1192 TOTAL RETURNED WITH NEW TM

OLD TM returned 0.3 x 4950 = 1485

1192/1485 = 0.8

**20% NERF TO DAMAGE RETURNED VS STANDARD ADC BUILD COMPARED WITH OLD THORNMAIL**

**WITH 12% CRIT FROM RUNES, BECOMES A 24% NERF**

_Riiiiiiiiiiiiiiight_.

Against a champion with 100 AD new thornmail on its own reflects more damage than old (30 old vs 15 + 25 = 40 new). The more armor you build, the more you reflect. With a full armor build (700 armor) malphite can reflect 190ish damage from someone with 300 AD while only taking 36 damage if they don't have armor pen. However, black cleaver counters thornmail even harder now since it shreds armor which reduces thornmail's reflection damage

700 armor.

And that is if you counter just 1 or 2 enemy AD. 

Then BC + LW = 40% + 6x5% = 70% armor ignored.

30% from 700 = 210 armor. That's how much you'll have.

210 armor while neglecting Mres/HP/other utility items.
That's poor.

Now how about an actual situation?  You know, where it's late game and you're the tank, but they have balanced damage so you're sitting at around 300 armor and 230mr with 3800HP, because you sacrificed some health for more in the form of thornmail.  But they have a bruiser with Black Cleaver and their ADC has IE, PD, LW, and BT along with their greaves.  So the bruiser hops in with their tank, and you do your best to peel off of your adc, taking the brunt of the damage.  After a couple seconds your armor is reduced to 210 from that cleaver, and you've already taken 600 damage.  That ADC starts hitting you now, with basic autos hitting for 300 and crits for 750 before resistances.  Now that's fine, except you essentially have about 135 armor left because of their armor pen.  Not to mention their autos are coming twice a second.  Even worse if the enemy has a champion with an armor reduction skill.

THIS POST IS INACCURATE. Did I get your attention? Good. Now, they have stated on the PBE that the initial 15% damage reflection from thornmail is pre-mitigation damage, so damage that WOULD have been dealt before resistances. This is similar to what they did with will of the ancients. Additionally it scales with armor, though the scaling damage is post-mitigation. Anyway, THE MORE YOU KNOW.

It's still a passive that provides zero interaction between players, something that Riot was working on to fix as a gameplay issue. 

No matter how much it gets nerfed and how much it is underpar, it still needs a rework.

A fighter hard counters an adc in a 1v1, but an ADC is supposed to counter a fighter in team fights / peel.

This item changed that.  You buy it against a fed carry and suddenly the carry, the only one who can put out the constant damage needed to take you down, is unable to do so.

Good change.
